abstract.p: We study Pisot numbers $\beta \in (1,2)$ which are univoque, i.e., such that there exists only one representation of 1 as $1 = \sum\nolimits_{n \ge 1} {s_n \beta ^{ - n} } $ with $s_n \beta ^{ - n} \{ 0,1\} $ . We prove in particular that there exists a smallest univoque Pisot number, which has degree 14. Furthermore we give the smallest limit point of the set of univoque Pisot numbers.
